授業目的: This course is designed to equip the student to understand basic historical background of Christianity and basic concepts and familiarize terms in Christian theology and Bible. It is also directed towards enabling the student to understand social issues to be taken as a mission of Christian. The following questions are something that can be the foundation of class direction. What impact Jesus of Nazareth made that drew believers to this new religion? How Christianity spread to other nations in the world? How many Christians are present in the world today?  How do Christians define themselves?  What are the divisions among the Christians in the world today?
到達目標:
To obtain basic understanding of Christianity

トピック.授業計画1:
Part I Thinking about what is religion
Week 1 introduction of direction and aims of the course and the sharing one’s religious and cultural background

Part II Historical background of Christianity
Week 2 Lecture on an overview of the formation of early Church
Week 3 Lecture on an overview of the Medieval conflict
Week 4 Lecture on an overview of Modern period

Part III Learning about Bible as literature
Week 5 Lecture on formation of New Testament
Week 6 Lecture on Gospel writers, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John
Week 7 Lecture on what is the common portrait of Jesus in the Gospel
Week 8 Lectures on Letters of Paul
Week 9 Mid-term exam some facts related questions

Part VI Christianity and Its Mission
Week 10 Film “Romero”
Week 11 the rest of the film and discussion

Par V Christianity and Society
Week 12 Lecture on Christian social role in Korea
Week 13 Christian social role in Japan-- Field trip to Kamagasaki
Week 14 discussion and evaluation on the course; what did you learn about the topics?
